com.esri.mo2.src.file
Interface FileHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
CADFileHandler, DBaseFileHandler, ImagefileHandler, RPFfileHandler, SDCFileHandler, ShapefileHandler, VPFHandler
public interface FileHandler

FileHandlers provide a generic way to obtain the content provided by a FileFolderConnection. Each FileHandler will "know" about one or more types of Content, and will filter the list of files according to that knowledge. For example, a ShapefileFileHandler will determine all the files that form an ESRI shapefile dataset

See Also:
FileSystemConnection

Method Detail

filter

public void filter(File[] list,
                   LinkedList contents)
filter files from the given list of files (normally located within a particular folder). Determine which Files correspond to a particular type of Content, construct the Content, then remove the corresponding files from the list by setting their entry to null. All Contents constructed must be added to the contents LinkedList. If any Content cannot be constructed because of some problem, but would otherwise be considered a Content, a corresponding InvalidContent should be added to the contents LinkedList and the corresponding files removed from the list.

Parameters:
list - the original list of Files
contents - the list of constructed Content
See Also:
InvalidContent

getAvailableContentTypes

public String[] getAvailableContentTypes()
obtain all the Content types that can be created by this FileHandler. Each content type string is an identifier for the types this Folder can create.

Note that this method is never called by MapObjects—Java, therefore a custom implementation of this method can simply return a size zero String array: return new String[0];

Returns:
a zero-length String array

getContentDescription

public String getContentDescription(String type)
obtain a short description for the given Content type, typically, for use as display within a user interface.

NOTE: THIS METHOD HAS NOT YET BEEN IMPLEMENTED.

Parameters:
type - the required content type
Returns:
a description of the given content type, null == content type is not available in this handler

createContent

public Content createContent(Folder folder,
                             String name,
                             String type)
                      throws IOException
create a new Content of the given name and type within the given folder.

NOTE: THIS METHOD HAS NOT YET BEEN IMPLEMENTED.

Parameters:
folder - that will contain the required content
name - the required content name
type - the required content type
Returns:
the new Content, null == unsuccessful (the content type is not available or the name already exists)
IOException
